document_data.name: Pharnilla
document_data.mainbody:
'''Pharnilla''' was a news hawker who worked for the ''[[Baldur's Mouth]] Gazette'' in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|''Sorry, I can't sell you the broadsheet yet. Got to take my stinky break first. Booooooring.''|Pharnilla}}
document_data.Description: Pharnilla was a pale-skinned [[human]] boy with dark brown eyes and long strawberry blonde hair. He wore a quality green tunic.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Pharnilla could often be found peddling the ''Baldur's Mouth Gazette'' across the street from [[Beehive Goods and Wares]] in the Lower City alongside [[Dellys]], with whom Pharnilla took breaks. He didn't like taking breaks, thinking them boring and lamented not being able to read his own stock to pass the time.
